author: rudolf6
content:
As mentioned on ACD re the quantum computing discussion: i'm helping organize a small, informal effort to: (i) better understand timelines/progress from experts in the field, (2) map out in-protocol components affected/high-level mitigation strategies. This is mostly intended as an educational exercise to start, and to perhaps serve as an input in other long-term cryptography decisions down the road. I think most agree it's not an urgent issue, but the goal is to at least better understand the landscape for now  ðŸ˜…

If anyone has already spent time thinking about this or would like to assist, please ping me. Will move the conversation over to <#800773302213279784>  going forward.

author: tbenr
content: following up with what we discussed in the last ACD, I opened https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3864 it is less important as a change (tiny one) more to start a discussion over the potential consequences

author: jochembrouwer
content: Oh, I think I might like this place better than magicians (or just do both)

author: tersec
content: formerly-known-as-Twitter tends to be behind a login-wall and seems sometimes subject to arbitrary management whims. Discord's archive/search ability is flaky at best and also is behind a login-wall to even view. So of the initial three options, magicians was the most reasonable one. But yeah, ethereum/pm also satisfies these criteria

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yes, the login wall is a no-go for me ðŸ™‚ EthMagicians or GitHub both seem fine to me, but maybe GitHub a somewhat more logical / centralized ( ðŸ˜¬ ) place, and magicians a more logical place to also allow async discussions. So I'm not sure where my preference would go ðŸ˜…
